source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk1
evidence_span: The primary heat transport system (PHTS) coolant, in contact with tube inside surface, is heavy water $\mathbf { ( D _ { 2 } O ) }$ at ${ \sim } 1 0 \ \mathbf { M P a }$ with a pH of $\sim 1 0 . 3$ maintained by LiOH, and with 3 to $1 0 \mathrm { c m } ^ { 3 } \mathrm { H } _ { 2 } / \mathrm { k g }$ coolant added to suppress radiolytically produced oxygen.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk2

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk2
evidence_span: Controlled gaseous exposures were performed in an ultra-high vacuum (uhv) chamber $( \sim 1 0 ^ { - 8 } \ \mathsf { P a } )$ equipped with sample heaters capable of maintaining temperature within $\pm 1 \mathrm { } \mathrm { } \mathrm { } \mathrm { } \mathrm { \bf { C } } .$

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk2
evidence_span: Aqueous exposures were conducted with ${ \bf D } _ { 2 } { \bf O }$ in static Inconel 600 autoclaves. The $\mathsf { p H }$ was maintained at 10.5 by addition of LiOH from a standard 1-M solution.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk2
evidence_span: Hydrogen and oxygen concentrations of 700 to 1000 $\mu \mathrm { L } \Lambda$ and $< 2 5 \ \mathsf { p p b }$ , respectively, were measured in samples of autoclave water following purging with $\mathbf { H } _ { 2 }$ gas prior to exposures.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk2

These had been exposed to reactor gas annuli $( \mathbf { N } _ { 2 }$ or $\mathbf { C O } _ { 2 } )$ at ${ \sim } 3 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ with ${ \bf D } _ { 2 } { \bf O }$ partial pressures ranging from ${ \sim } 0 . 2 5$ to ${ \sim } 2 0 0 ~ \mathrm { P a }$ and $\mathbf { D } _ { 2 }$ partial pressures between ${ \sim } 1 0$ and $1 0 0 \ \mathbf { P a }$ for up to 13 years.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: A thin sample of $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N } \mathbf { b }$ was exposed to $1 \times 1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ Pa of ${ \bf D } _ { 2 } { \bf O }$ vapor at $3 8 0 \mathrm { { ^ \circ C } }$ for $3 6 0 \ \mathrm { h }$ to determine the rate of permeation into the bulk alloy (Table 2: Row 8). Practically no deuterium in the bulk alloy was detected by DSC following this exposure.

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: Samples of $\mathbf { Z r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N b }$ exposed to a gaseous environment consisting of predominantly deuterium gas $( 1 0 ^ { - 3 } \ \mathbf { P a } )$ with only $1 0 ^ { - 5 }$ Pa ${ \bf D } _ { 2 } { \bf O }$ at $3 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ for $4 8 \mathrm { { h } }$ (Table 2: Row 3) exhibited lower deuterium concentration at the surface and within the oxide as shown in Fig. 1. The resulting bulk alloy deuterium uptake was still below detectability.

conditions.atmosphere: predominantly D2 gas with 1E-5 Pa D2O

source_id: STP1245-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_10th Volume_008_chunk5
evidence_span: However, when samples were exposed to the same gaseous environment at $3 8 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ (to accelerate uptake) for $^ { 3 3 0 \mathrm { h } }$ , a significant uptake by the bulk alloy was observed (Table 2: Row 9).

conditions.atmosphere: predominantly D2 gas with 1E-5 Pa D2O

evidence_span: Following sample exposure, bulk alloy deuterium uptake was $\sim 1 2 \ \mu \bf { g } / c m ^ { 2 }$ determined by DSC.

conditions.atmosphere: predominantly D2 gas with 1E-5 Pa D2O

evidence_span: The thickness of the oxide remained practically unchanged.
